pageContext.description: Coppery appearance.  Edge shows signs of [...] grinding
pageContext.patina: Grey green - traces of golden bronze.
pageContext.other: Under "Site", which is here transcribed word for word, is the word "unprovenanced" written in biro.
pageContext.collection: Ludlow Museum, transferred from Whitchurch Museum, Shropshire, from collection of the late Mrs. LLoyd of Rhagatt near Corwen.  Given by her nephew the late Mayor P.T. Godsal.  Iscoyd Pk., nr. Whitchurch. (no. 1)
pageContext.site: wales (almost certainly), denbigshire or merionethshire (probably), rhagatt hall (on the estate)
pageContext.remarks: Believed to have been found on the estate of Rhagatt Hall, near Corwen, which extends from Merionethshire into Denbighshire, but possibly found in making the terrace at Iscoyd Park in 1855.,  Cf. Inventory of the Ancient Monuments of Flintshire 338,  ,
